translation: ropień, wrzód [a painful swollen area on or in the body that contains pus]
sentence: She had an abscess on her gum.

translation: przedpokój, poczekalnia [formal; a small room, especially a waiting room, that leads into a larger, more important room]
sentence: The ministers waited for their meeting in the Cabinet anteroom.

translation: surowy [plain, simple, and without unnecessary decorations or luxuries; strict or severe]
sentence: My father was a distant, austere man.

translation: na opak, krzywo, opacznie [not in the intended manner, or out of position, or wrong]
sentence: There are too many people involved, and something is bound to go awry.

translation: nieoświecony [literary; without knowledge or morals]
sentence: Some of the early explorers thought of the local people as benighted savages who could be exploited.

translation: oczarować, urzec [to attract or impress someone so much that they cannot think in a sensible way]
sentence: He was completely bewitched by her beauty.

translation: niewola [the state of being another person's slave]
sentence: The slaves were kept in bondage until their death.

translation: pękaty [shaped like a bulb; round and fat in an ugly way]
sentence: He had a huge, bulbous nose.

translation: obywatele, mieszkańcy (jako całość) [all the citizens of a particular town, country, etc.]
sentence: Nearly a half century old, the system has served its citizenry well.

translation: obowiązkowy, przymusowy [(of something) that must be done; necessary by law or a rule]
sentence: The law made wearing seat belts in cars compulsory.

translation: interpretować, odbierać [to understand the meaning of something in a particular way]
sentence: That comment could be construed in either of two ways.

translation: skurczenie, skurcz [the process of becoming smaller; a sudden and painful contracting of muscles, especially of the muscles around a woman's womb that happens when she is giving birth to a child]
sentence: Cold causes contraction of the metal.

translation: skruszony, pełen skruchy [formal; feeling very sorry and guilty for something bad that you have done]
sentence: She seemed genuinely contrite when she apologized.

translation: korpulentny
sentence: He is a short, somewhat corpulent, man.

translation: kula [a stick with a piece that fits under the arm, that you lean on for support if you have difficulty in walking because of a foot or leg injury]
sentence: Martin broke his leg and has been on crutches for the past six weeks.

translation: potępienie (publiczne) [public criticism of someone or something, or publicly accusing someone of something]
sentence: All parties joined in bitter denunciation of the terrorists.

translation: zaniedbanie [(formal or law) the fact of deliberately not doing what you ought to do, especially when it is part of your job; (especially of a building) a state of not being cared for]
sentence: The old railway station was in a state of dereliction.

translation: przyćmiony [not giving or having much light; that you cannot remember or imagine clearly]
sentence: The lamp gave out a dim light. She had a dim recollection of meeting him.

translation: hałas, harmider [a loud, unpleasant confused noise that lasts for a long time]
sentence: The children were making a terrible din.

translation: niepokojący, zatrważający [formal; causing worry and unhappiness]
sentence: The sheer size of their armed forces is a disquieting factor for neighboring countries.

translation: uniknąć, odskoczyć [to avoid being hit by something by moving quickly to one side]
sentence: He dodged to avoid the hurtling bicycle.

translation: przemoczyć [to make someone or something extremely wet]
sentence: A sudden thunderstorm had drenched us to the skin.

translation: nieuchwytny [difficult to describe, find, achieve, or remember]
sentence: The answers to these questions remain as elusive as ever.

translation: oczarowanie, zachwyt [a feeling of great pleasure and attraction, especially because something is very beautiful]
sentence: The audience looked on in utter fascination and enchantment.

translation: załączać [to send something in the same envelope or parcel as something else]
sentence: Please enclose a curriculum vitae with your application.

translation: ujmujący [making someone like you]
sentence: She laughs at herself a lot, which is always endearing.

translation: ogrom [the very great size, effect, etc. of something; the fact of something being very serious]
sentence: People are still coming to terms with the enormity of the disaster.

translation: uczestnik, początkujący [a person who takes part in a competition or an exam; a person who becomes a member of a group or organization]
sentence: All entrants complete two three-hour papers.

translation: wywierać, stosować [to use something such as authority, power, influence, etc in order to make something happen]
sentence: Some managers exert considerable pressure on their staff to work extra hours without being paid.

translation: ścinać drzewo [to cut down a tree]
sentence: He decided the diseased trees had to be felled.

translation: łowisko [an area of water where fish are caught so they can be sold]
sentence: The depletion of fisheries has serious impacts on food security.

translation: migotać [to shine with a light that is sometimes bright and sometimes weak]
sentence: I felt a cold draft and the candle started to flicker.

translation: listowie [the leaves of a plant or tree, or leaves on the stems or branches on which they are growing]
sentence: The dense foliage overhead almost blocked out the sun.

translation: pachnący, aromatyczny [having a pleasant smell]
sentence: The sauce itself was light, fragrant and slightly sweet.

translation: bawić się, dokazywać, broić [to play and behave in a happy way]
sentence: A group of suntanned children were frolicking on the beach.

translation: piana [a mass of small bubbles, especially on the surface of a liquid]
sentence: I like the froth on the top of the coffee.

translation: płukać gardło [to move a liquid around in your throat without swallowing, especially to clean it or stop it feeling painful]
sentence: For a sore throat, gargle with warm salt water.

translation: bardzo pochlebny [praising with enthusiasm]
sentence: His latest book has received glowing reviews.

translation: kleik [a cheap simple food made, especially in the past, by boiling oats with water or milk]
sentence: Prematurely weaned babies who are only fed rice gruel are the main problem.

translation: twarda okładka
sentence: The novel was published in hardcover.

translation: głóg [a type of small tree with thorns, white or pink flowers in spring, and small, red fruits in autumn]
sentence: However, it is clearly more expensive to plant such a hedge than a straightforward hawthorn hedge.

translation: pustelnik [a person who lives alone and apart from the rest of society, especially for religious reasons]
sentence: The old hermit was very cagey about her past life.

translation: dotychczas [formal; until now or until a particular time]
sentence: Mira revealed hitherto unsuspected talents on the dance floor.

translation: chochlik [(in stories) a small ugly creature that likes to trick people or cause trouble]
sentence: I think that that is probably a hobgoblin that we can put behind us for the indefinite future.

translation: nacięcie [an opening that is made in something with a sharp tool, especially in someone's body during an operation]
sentence: The surgeon makes a small incision into which a tube is inserted.

translation: nierozwiązywalny (lub nierozpuszczalny) [(of a problem) so difficult that it is impossible to solve; (of a substance) impossible to dissolve]
sentence: Traffic congestion in large cities seems to be an insoluble problem.

translation: przeplatać, poprzekładać [to mix one thing in with another in a way that is not regular]
sentence: Lectures will be interspersed with practical demonstrations.

translation: orzeźwiać [to make someone feel fresher, healthier, and more energetic]
sentence: We were invigorated by our walk.

translation: strażnik więzienny, klawisz
sentence: As Dean left the building, the jailer sauntered back to Fred's cell.

translation: pomost [a wooden structure at the edge of the sea or a lake where people can get on and off boats]
sentence: An ecological study station and a cafe could be attached to these jetties.

translation: wesz [a small insect that lives on the bodies of humans and animals]
sentence: Flies, lice, gadflies and mosquitoes are the worst of the insect plagues.

translation: wrogi [literary; causing or wanting to cause harm or evil]
sentence: The central character is a malevolent witch out for revenge.

translation: łagodny, aksamitny, dojrzały [(of color or sound) soft, rich, and pleasant; (of a taste or flavor) smooth and pleasant; (of people) calm, gentle, and reasonable because of age or experience]
sentence: Mellow music and lighting helped to create the right atmosphere.

translation: zabawa [literary; the act of celebrating and having an enjoyable time]
sentence: The eating, drinking, and merrymaking went on late into the night.

translation: zapodziać, gubić [to lose something temporarily by forgetting where you have put it]
sentence: Could I borrow a pen? I seem to have mislaid mine.

translation: zjadliwy [formal; (especially of humor) cruel and criticizing in a humorous way]
sentence: His mordant wit appealed to students.

translation: prześcigać, wyprzedzać [to be or become greater in amount, degree, or success than something or someone]
sentence: The demand for food in the war zone now far outstrips supply.

translation: paleta
sentence: The website helps corporations sell pallets of unneeded merchandise.

translation: spiżarnia [a small room or large cupboard in a house where food is kept]
sentence: The poorer people are, the more often they go to the shop too; they almost make the shop their pantry.

translation: spieczony, wysuszony [(especially of earth or crops) dried out because of too much heat and not enough rain]
sentence: It was the height of summer and the land was parched and brown.

translation: pergamin
sentence: He'd been ill for a long time, and his skin was like parchment.

translation: nawierzchnia drogi [the surface of a road when it has been covered with concrete or tarmac]
sentence: Two cars skidded on the icy pavement.

translation: huk, salwa śmiechu [a long loud sound or series of sounds, especially of laughter or thunder]
sentence: A loud peal of thunder woke him from restless sleep.

translation: czasopismo [a magazine or newspaper, especially on a serious subject, that is published regularly]
sentence: She has written for several legal periodicals.

translation: męczyć, udręczać [to annoy someone, especially by asking them something many times]
sentence: Journalists pestered neighbors for information.

translation: zaraza [formal or old-use; any very serious infectious disease that spreads quickly and kills large numbers of people]
sentence: They have flood, pestilence, fire, and earthquake, and governments are another calamity.

translation: zapylać [to take pollen from one plant or part of a plant to another so that new plant seeds can be produced]
sentence: Bees pollinate the plants by carrying the pollen from one flower to another.

translation: zakładać, przyjmować (że) [to suggest something as a basic fact or principle from which a further idea is formed or developed]
sentence: Most religions posit the existence of life after death.

translation: przykazanie, nakaz, zasada [a rule for action or behavior, especially obtained from moral thought]
sentence: This policy goes against common precepts of decency.

translation: zamiłowanie, szczególne upodobanie [formal; a strong liking or preference]
sentence: Ever since she was a child, she has had a predilection for spicy food.

translation: udawanie, pozór [the act of behaving in a particular way, in order to make other people believe something that is not true]
sentence: Their friendliness was only pretense.

translation: dziewiczy, nieskazitelny, idealny [new or almost new, and in very good condition]
sentence: Washing machine for sale - only two months old and in pristine condition.

translation: bluźnierczy [showing no respect for a god or a religion, often through language]
sentence: His letter is too profane to print, but it is very funny, too.

translation: bojaźliwy [formal; weak and cowardly; frightened of taking risks]
sentence: He's too pusillanimous to stand up to his opponents.

translation: przepiórka
sentence: Quails' eggs are considered to be a delicacy.

translation: zrównać z ziemią [to completely destroy a city, building, etc.]
sentence: The village was razed to the ground.

translation: siatkówka oka
sentence: The injection site in the peripheral retina can be seen at the lower left corner.

translation: odparować [to answer someone quickly in an angry or funny way]
sentence: "That doesn't concern you!" she retorted.

translation: złościć, irytować [informal; to annoy or make angry]
sentence: Nothing ever seemed to rile him.

translation: rozbudzić [to wake someone up or make someone more active or excited]
sentence: The speaker attempted to rouse the crowd with a cry for action.

translation: chuligański, hałaśliwy, awanturniczy [(of people) making a lot of noise or likely to cause trouble]
sentence: The theater was full of rowdy teenagers throwing popcorn and yelling.

translation: szeleścić [to make soft sounds, or to cause something, such as cloth, paper, or leaves, to make soft sounds]
sentence: The leaves rustled in the breeze.

translation: mędrzec [literary; wise, especially as a result of great experience]
sentence: In that time, the simple and the scholarly could equally be sages.

translation: przeczyścić, przeszukać [to search a place or thing very carefully in order to try to find something; to remove dirt from something by rubbing it hard with something rough]
sentence: You'll have to scour out those old cooking pots before you use them.

translation: przepychanka, mała bójka [a short fight in which people push each other]
sentence: Two police officers were injured in scuffles with demonstrators at Sunday's protest.

translation: pędzić, krzątać się [to move quickly, with small, short steps]
sentence: The mouse scurried across the floor.

translation: zadufany w sobie [feeling or behaving as if what you say or do is always morally right, and other people are wrong]
sentence: He's so self-righteous - like he's never done anything wrong in his life.

translation: gablota, wizytówka, pokaz [a cabinet, usually of glass, in which objects are kept that are valuable or easily broken; a place or event where something, esp. something new, can be shown or performed]
sentence: The Sundance Film Festival is an especially sympathetic showcase for unusual films.

translation: drobne kawałki [informal; a lot of very small broken pieces]
sentence: The city was bombed to smithereens during the war.

translation: orkisz
sentence: Wheat, barley and spelt were the leading crops.

translation: mąż stanu [an experienced politician, especially one who is respected for making good judgments]
sentence: He was a statesman who opened Hawaii to international relations.

translation: bezruch [total lack of movement or changing of position]
sentence: They gazed into the stillness of the water.

translation: na wznak, na plecach [formal; (lying) flat on your back, looking up]
sentence: We walked along the beach, past the rows of supine bodies soaking up the sun.

translation: obrus
sentence: The dining room table was set with a linen tablecloth under a handmade lace cover.

translation: drozd
sentence: One early thrush gave me a note or two as I drove along the woodland path.

translation: smakołyk [a small piece of interesting information, or a small dish of pleasant-tasting food]
sentence: Our guide gave us some interesting tidbits about the history of the castle.

translation: apatia, letarg [formal; the state of not being active and having no energy or enthusiasm; the state of reduced activity that some animals experience during the winter]
sentence: In the heat they sank into a state of torpor.

translation: wkroczyć na czyjś teren [to go onto someone's land or enter their building without permission]
sentence: I hope this is a public footpath and we're not trespassing on someone's land.

translation: napuszony, nabrzmiały [(of speech, writing, style, etc.) boring and too serious about its subject matter; swollen; containing more water than usual]
sentence: As a writer he was apt to be turgid and prolix, and there was a somewhat un-English element of ostentation in his manner.

translation: brzdęk [the sound that is made by pulling a tight string or wire]
sentence: We heard a twang as the cable broke.

translation: powierzyć, zaszczycić [give or grant (something) to (someone) in a gracious or condescending manner]
sentence: He vouchsafed to me certain family secrets.

translation: skrzywiony, chory [(of a person) having ideas that most people think are strange or unpleasant; bent or twisted and not in the normal shape]
sentence: In their warped minds I was to blame for my own victimization.

translation: strata, ubytek [the amount that is wasted; the fact of losing or destroying something, especially because it has been used or dealt with carelessly]
sentence: Water companies will have to cut down on wastage.

translation: warkot, furkot [a continuous low sound, for example the sound made by the regular movement of a machine or the wings of a bird]
sentence: There was a whirring of machinery.

translation: siła woli
sentence: It took a lot of willpower to stay calm.
